name: She Loves Me Trivia Game | She Loves Me | 25 Questions

questions.text: What movie is the musical "She Loves Me" based on?
questions.explanation:
Shop Around the Corner.

	"You've Got Mail" is the modern version of "Shop Around the Corner" but since "She Loves Me" came in the 60's obviously it wasn't based on a 90's movie. "Green Grow the Lilacs" is the book that "Oklahoma" is based on. "Tales of the South Pacific" is the book that "South Pacific" is based on.

questions.text: What country does this musical take place in?
questions.explanation:
Hungary.

	Sipos sings that Hungary is "one of many countries on this continent of which there are several continents."

questions.text: What is the name of the lead character?
questions.explanation:
Georg.

	Georg Novak is the man who is exchanging letters with a Amalia Bolish.

questions.text: What kind of a shop do the characters work in?
questions.explanation:
Perfume.

	Whenever someone leaves, all the sales people sing "Thank You" to them.

questions.text: What does Kodaly say the musical cigarette box will do?
questions.correct: "Make music lovers out of smokers, and smokers out of music lovers."
options: "Be stolen in two shakes of a lamb's tail."
"No one would ever buy those ugly things."
questions.explanation:
"Make music lovers out of smokers, and smokers out of music lovers."

	Georg said that no one would buy musical cigarette boxes, so Mareczek asks Kodaly what he thinks.

questions.text: In the song "Sound While Selling" complete this line: "I would like an eyebrow...under my ______."
questions.explanation:
chin.

	This song shows what it sounds like when people are shopping, all the words are jumbled because you hear bits and pieces of everyone's conversations.

questions.text: Who owns the shop the characters work in?
questions.explanation:
Mr.  Maraczek

	Arpad is the delivery boy. Georg Novak and Stephen Kodaly are salesmen in the shop. Later on, Arpad also becomes a salesman.

questions.text: In the song "Three Letters" what book does Georg ask "Dear Friend" if she has read?
options: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
questions.explanation:
War and Peace.

	"If it weren't for your endearing letters, I'd be flying south with all the geese. By the way, have you read, 'War and Peace'?"

questions.text: Who tells Georg, "I'm an idiot, but at least I'm an idiot with a job."?
questions.explanation:
Sipos.

	Sipos tells him this right before he sings "Perspectives" in which he gives Georg his five words of advice "Do not lose your job."

questions.text: In the song "I Resolve" why does Ilona say she must be "cousin to a cat."
questions.correct: "I always wind up with a rat."
questions.explanation:
"I always wind up with a rat."

	She sings this when she wises up to the fact that Kodaly has been cheating on her. She has resolved "Not to be so stupid".

questions.text: What is supposed to be in the book that Amalia has so Georg will know she is "Dear Friend"?
questions.explanation:
rose.

	The rose is inside the book "Anna Karenina" by Leo Tolstoy.

questions.text: Georg was having an affair with Maraczek's wife
questions.explanation:
False.

	It was Kodaly that was having the affair. Mr. Maraczek had been treating Georg wrong because he assumed it was Georg. He feels so badly about this that he tries to commit suicide but ends up shooting himself in the shoulder instead.

questions.text: What does Amalia try to find in her room so she can go to work, because she thinks Georg thinks she's lying about being sick?
questions.explanation:
shoe.

	The song "Where's My Shoe?" is a hilarious song. If you've seen the show it's even funnier, because inside her closet when she opens it, it is full of shoes, yet she's frantically trying to search for this one shoe. She is worried about being late, so one would think she would just get another pair and go to work.

questions.text: What kind of ice cream does Georg bring Amalia?
questions.explanation:
Vanilla.

	During this song Amalia starts to fall in love with Georg. She still doesn't realize he's "Dear Friend." Georg however, does know who she is because he saw her in the restaurant and then got rid of the flower so she wouldn't know who he was.

questions.text: Amalia complains about the ice cream because it has too much salt in it. Georg tells her "Is it any wonder, you've been crying in it." What does Amalia reply?
questions.correct: "I better cry in the other direction then."
options: "I can't help it, I love you so much Georg."
questions.explanation:
"I better cry in the other direction then."

	Georg reminds her of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde. First he seems like this terrible man, but then when she gets to know him she finds he is a wonderful person.

questions.text: According to Georg in the song "She Loves Me" why is Georg freezing?
options: "That's because I'm standing in snow now."
questions.explanation:
"That's because it's cold out."

	This show has great lyrics, especially in the song "She Loves Me". The lyrics were written by Sheldon Harnick. Music was written by Jerry Bock and the libretto was written by Joe Masteroff.

questions.text: Ilona meets a man at the library which she tells the others about in "Trip to the Library." What is the man's name?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	Paul is an optometrist.

questions.text: Ilona is illiterate.
questions.explanation:
True.

	She says that Paul offered to teach her how to read.

questions.text: Who gets fired in the second act of the show?
questions.explanation:
Kodaly.

	Mr. Maraczek has Georg fire Kodaly because Kodaly was sleeping with Mr. Maraczek's wife.

questions.text: Which one of these is not a day sung about in "Twelve Days To Christmas"?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Each day the shoppers get closer to Christmas, they become less cheerful especially towards those shoppers smart enough to do their shopping early and not wait until the last minute.

questions.text: Arpad is willing to give up something if he can become a sales person. What is he willing to give up?
options: he's not willing to give up anything.
questions.explanation:
bike.

	Arpad tells Mareczek this in the song "Try Me." Later on in the scene, he says that perhaps he could keep his bike and be both a salesman and a delivery boy.

questions.text: Kodaly says he doesn't want to come back to the store, and Sipos says "You couldn't you were just fired." How does Kodaly reply?
questions.correct: "All right, believe that, if it makes you happy."
options: "Ah Sipos, I see you also believe the lies."
questions.explanation:
"All right, believe that, if it makes you happy."

	Kodaly has the best exit song in the history of musicals. His exit song is "It's Been Grand Knowing You" in which you see the true personality of this man.

questions.text: How long did Georg know who Amalia was before he lets her know?
questions.explanation:
2 weeks.

	"Two weeks, I've known for two weeks. I wanted to tell you. I didn't dare."

questions.text: What are the words that Georg sings that suddenly make Amalia realize that "Dear Friend" and Georg are the same person?
questions.correct: "I am so sorry about last night."
options: "Butterfingers, do that again that's the end of your career."
"It's been grand knowing you, grand being your friend."
questions.explanation:
"I am so sorry about last night."

	"She loves meeeee" is from the song "She Loves Me" which he sings when he realizes that Amalia loves him even though she doesn't realize yet it's him she loves because she doesn't know he's "Dear Friend". "It's been grand knowing you" was Kodaly's exit song. "Butterfingers, do that again that's the end of your career" is what the head waiter sings when another waiter trips and falls in "Romantic Atmosphere".

questions.text: What is the name of the modern movie that came from "Shop Around the Corner" that also has a plot much like "She Loves Me"?
questions.explanation:
You've Got Mail.

	In this modern version, they get to know each other via the internet.
